comments:
Help worked fine in 2.0.  After I upgraded to 2.1 when I go to use help I 
get "help cannot be displayed. the embedded application server could not run 
help web application.  check log for details."  The log shows
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/help/AppServer
	at org.eclipse.soap.server.internal.SoapServerPlugin.earlyStartup
(SoapServerPlugin.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$15.run(Workbench.java:1327)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run
(InternalPlatform.java:889)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:413)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$14.run(Workbench.java:1334)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:498)
!ENTRY org.eclipse.help 4 0 Jun 13, 2003 14:00:33.935
!MESSAGE E042
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Location of plug-in 
org.eclipse.help.webapp cannot be resolved.
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.appserver.WebappManager.getWebappPath
(WebappManager.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.appserver.WebappManager.start
(WebappManager.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.HelpSystem.ensureWebappRunning
(HelpSystem.java:223)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.DefaultHelpSupport.displayHelpURL
(DefaultHelpSupport.java:199)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.DefaultHelpSupport.displayHelp
(DefaultHelpSupport.java:49)
	at org.eclipse.help.ui.internal.HelpContentsAction$1.run
(HelpContentsAction.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:69)
	at org.eclipse.help.ui.internal.HelpContentsAction.run
(HelpContentsAction.java:44)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PluginAction.runWithEvent
(PluginAction.java:251)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WWinPluginAction.runWithEvent
(WWinPluginAction.java:207)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection
(ActionContributionItem.java:456)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetEvent
(ActionContributionItem.java:403)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$0
(ActionContributionItem.java:397)
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$ActionListener.handleEvent
(ActionContributionItem.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1385)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:845)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)
!ENTRY org.eclipse.help.appserver 4 0 Jun 13, 2003 14:00:34.26
!MESSAGE Location of plug-in org.eclipse.help.webapp cannot be resolved.

What JDK are you using?
How did you upgrade to 2.1?

Perhaps you are using the old deprecated API's to launch the server in your 
soap plugin.
Take a look at org.eclipse.help.appserver.internal.WebappManager

I'm using JDK 1.3.0 from IBM.   I upgraded from 2.0 to 2.1 by doing a fresh 
install of 2.1, downloading from the site, and then reinstalling plugins and
redefining projects.  I didn't attempt to install 2.1 over 2.0 because it wasn't
clear that that was supported or would work.   I am not doing plugin 
development or using any internal APIs deliberately ... eclipse for me is a 
java development environment.  However, I have installed one plugin that does 
not come from the eclipse site:  that is the CMVC plugin and I don't know what 
it might be doing internally.  If this doesn't help suggest what might be 
wrong, I don't know what else to do.  It seems I may be the only sufferer from 
this particular problem since if help was broken for the masses you would know 
it by now.

There is a bug in this JDK, it is no longer supported.  You need at least JDK 
1.3.1  You can get 1.3.1 or 1.4.1 JDK from IBM.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 35776 ***

traces.message: Location of plug-in  org.eclipse.help.webapp cannot be resolved.
